qas.question: How long did Muslim control of Palermo last?
What did the Arabs introduce that continues to be relevant to Palermo's culture today?
How were the indigenous Palermo population treated under Muslim rule?
Who took control of the island in the 9th century?
What Emerite did the Muslims establish in the 9th century?
What city displaced Palermo as the capital during Arab rule?
What cities did Syracuse compete with in terms of importance and splendor?
What did Sicilians introduce to the Arabs?

context: The <b3_0>Muslims<b3_0/> took control of the Island in 904, after decades of fierce fighting, and the <b4_0>Emirate of Sicily<b4_0/> was established. Muslim rule on the island lasted for about <a0_0>120 years<a0_0/> and was marked by cruelty and brutality against the native population, which was <a2_0>reduced into near slavery<a2_0/>[clarification needed] and Christian churches across the island were all completely destroyed.[page needed] Palermo (Balarm during Arab rule) displaced <b5_0>Syracuse<b5_0/> as the capital city of Sicily. It was said to have then begun to compete with <b6_0>Córdoba and Cairo<b6_0/> in terms of importance and splendor. For more than one hundred years Palermo was the capital of a flourishing emirate. The Arabs also introduced <b7_0>many <a1_0>agricultural crops<b7_0/><a1_0/> which remain a mainstay of Sicilian cuisine.
